WorkItem.ClosedComment: Fixed in recent build per comments
WorkItem.Description:
There are a couple of places where the number Rawr is showing for Crit and the in-game paper doll Crit are showing different numbers.  While I think rawr is using the correct numbers for calculations, it would be nice if it was easier to see that rawr matches in-game (I've used this matching to track down things like mismatch between what enchant I told rawr to use and what enchant was actually used.  Same thing with gemming.)  It also helps to find errors in imported gear -- like where the socket bonus on gloves mysteriously dissapered.  At any rate here's the differences:
  The in-game paper doll does not show "Crit Chance" due to the Tidal Force talent but Rawr does.
  The in-game paper doll does not show "Crit Chance" due to the Tidal Mastery talent but Rawr does.
And a very minor difference that might be hard to take into account and is likely not worth while to change (but I'll mention it anyhow :-)
  The in-game paper doess only shows "Crit Chance" due to the Thundering Strikes talent if a main hand weapon is equipped but Rarw always shows it.
WorkItem.Summary: [RestoSham] Difference between Rawr and in-game for crit

Comments.Message: I can agree, and moved Tidal Force out of the generic crit area, however instead of forcing it to match paper-doll exactly I've added a note no the tooltip to the effect that Tidal Mastery and talents like it are included in "Heal Spell Crit".
